project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Mobile Phone Banking Project in the Maldives is to significantly increase the use of banking system transactions for effecting or receiving payments for labor, goods and services nationwide through the implementation of a national inter-operable payments system that facilitates access to financial services and allows users access to their bank account using any mobile phone operator and cashing through any banking agent. The Government has requested for cancellation of US$ 1.5 million from the remaining un-utilized funds in the Maldives Mobile Phone Banking Project. Even though the infrastructure was available, the mobile payment system has not been implemented due to the non-cooperation of the major state bank of the country while the real time gross settlement system is operational and the automated clearing house function is partially operational. As the Project has already incurred the required expenses for setting up the mobile payment infrastructure and enhanced the capacity of the recipient and the Maldives monetary authority, the cancellation will not incur any adverse impact on the Project.
